sentences: Tema kodus on väga ilus aed.
Ma teen oma õhtuomanusid igal päeval.
Oma tervise ja sujuvuse tagamiseks pead pidevalt oma toitu jälgima.
context: 'Kohal' translates to 'at (one’s) home' or more literally, 'at the place.' It is commonly used in Estonian to denote being at a person's residence, whether their own or someone else's. For example, you might say 'Olen kodus kohal,' which means 'I am at home.'
